lexUnit.name: prefer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: like (someone or something) better than another or otherts; tend to choose

sentence.text: Some would argue , of course , that the reason why people still strongly prefer extra income over extra leisure is because they are manipulated by business interests or the ethos of a capitalist society .
Seychellois prefer the meat of female goats over that of males .
WordPerfect has responded angrily to Microsoft claims that a clear majority of users prefer Word for Windows over WordPerfect .
` Perhaps you would prefer my room to my company ?
I prefer white wine to red and I sometimes keep a bottle of champagne in the fridge ready for any impromptu celebrations .
The villagers still preferred this relationship of obligation to independence .
He prefers to parry rather then duck and sway .
Some might prefer the head not to be next to the cooker
Many owners prefer to feed adult dogs just once a day , but in fact , it may be better to offer food morning and evening , in smaller amounts .
It is also possible that party members in Barnsley would prefer a more moderate candidate .
He prefers ambitious subordinates .
I preferred foxes to foxhounds .
` You 've always preferred her to me .
Casual visitors to art museums generally prefer short guides to the official catalogues .
Most still prefer the rhetoric of victimisation or separatism .
I definitely much prefer this one .
I 've always much preferred to sell it to friends .
` Both put a great deal of time into their jobs , " Bloch says , ` and prefer rapid promotion to security and congenial work .
I prefer the single jewels to the elaborate crowns .
Adolescents conscious of personal appearance may prefer them to eyeglasses .
Growth is obviously preferred by people in organizations because it reduces conflict to manageable proportions ( Pfeffer 1981 ) .
Her guests might have preferred to drink their tea on the verandah outside , since at that moment it was not raining .
Also , charcoal is preferred because of its steady and concentrated heat , its smokeless burning , and because it can easily be extinguished when the fire is no longer needed .
